i opened this after seeing +1 from Ivan and Vishal thinking it needs more update and that's why they are not +2. Seems like horizon team need to get the +2 power here."}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:06:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> i opened this after seeing +1 from Ivan and Vishal thinking it
 > needs more update and that's why they are not +2. Seems like
 > horizon team need to get the +2 power here.

yeah, that's true maybe you can reply on this thread [1] as your TC hat and we get more recognization and +2 power in other horizon plugins especially which are not so active like masakari-dashboard.
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010303.html"}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2019-11-26 04:44:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Sorry to keep you waiting. I had business trip last week. Basically, dashboard plugins are subproject of each optional project and project core has approve permission for each dashboard plugin. If you need to rush, please contact them also. Horizon member does not tend to have responsibilities for plugins historically. If someone wants to be a core for dashboard plugins, I'll add him/her with pleasure."}]

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

senlin-dashboard is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Change-Id: Ib279cb1d0820ef6e9a07079ccd2bb7768b5f5967

commit_message:
Add zones wrinkle to TestMultiCellMigrate

This creates an availability zone for each cell in
the functional test to ensure that the instance
availability_zone in the database is properly updated
when migrating the instance across cells and zones.

This can also be used later during revert resize testing
to ensure the instance AZ is properly updated on revert.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I97d0567c77eaaa9af0895ed58918c4c61377e926

subject: Handle target host cross-cell cold migration in conductor

[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-11 22:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-03-12 07:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

Change-Id: I2f61a4513135c9b514d938ca18c2c9c87f24403a
'}, {'created': '2019-05-09 22:21:44.000000000', 'message': 'Handle target host cross-cell cold migration in conductor

Because of change If7ea02df42d220c5042947efdef4777509492a0b,
when cold migrating with a target host, the cell on the
requested destination will be used to lookup that host
(compute node) to set the in_tree attribute on the
RequestGroup. When doing a targeted cold migration across
cells, the target host could be in another cell from the
Destination.cell (which is the source cell per the
MigrationTask._restrict_request_spec_to_cell method).
In this scenario, we aren't "preferring" the source cell
necessarily if the target host is in another cell.

This change simply removes the Destination.cell attribute
during a cold migration with a target host so that the
scheduler will look in all enabled cells for the host.
Alternatively, we could lookup the HostMapping for the
requested target host and set the Destination.cell attribute
appropriately but HostManager.get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node
is going to do that for us anyway.

This also implements one of the TODO functional tests for
cross-cell migrate by targeting a specific host in another
cell for the cold migration. The functional test will fail
without the fix in conductor.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I2f61a4513135c9b514d938ca18c2c9c87f24403a

'}, {'created': '2019-09-21 23:24:12.000000000', 'message': 'Handle target host cross-cell cold migration in conductor

Because of change If7ea02df42d220c5042947efdef4777509492a0b,
when cold migrating with a target host, the cell on the
requested destination will be used to lookup that host
(compute node) to set the in_tree attribute on the
RequestGroup. When doing a targeted cold migration across
cells, the target host could be in another cell from the
Destination.cell (which is the source cell per the
MigrationTask._restrict_request_spec_to_cell method).
In this scenario, we aren't "preferring" the source cell
necessarily if the target host is in another cell.

This change simply removes the Destination.cell attribute
during a cold migration with a target host so that the
scheduler will look in all enabled cells for the host.
Alternatively, we could lookup the HostMapping for the
requested target host and set the Destination.cell attribute
appropriately but HostManager.get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node
is going to do that for us anyway.

This also implements one of the TODO functional tests for
cross-cell migrate by targeting a specific host in another
cell for the cold migration. The functional test will fail
without the fix in conductor.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

commit_message:
Handle target host cross-cell cold migration in conductor

Because of change If7ea02df42d220c5042947efdef4777509492a0b,
when cold migrating with a target host, the cell on the
requested destination will be used to lookup that host
(compute node) to set the in_tree attribute on the
RequestGroup. When doing a targeted cold migration across
cells, the target host could be in another cell from the
Destination.cell (which is the source cell per the
MigrationTask._restrict_request_spec_to_cell method).
In this scenario, we aren't "preferring" the source cell
necessarily if the target host is in another cell.

This change simply removes the Destination.cell attribute
during a cold migration with a target host so that the
scheduler will look in all enabled cells for the host.
Alternatively, we could lookup the HostMapping for the
requested target host and set the Destination.cell attribute
appropriately but HostManager.get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node
is going to do that for us anyway.

This also implements one of the TODO functional tests for
cross-cell migrate by targeting a specific host in another
cell for the cold migration. The functional test will fail
without the fix in conductor.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I2f61a4513135c9b514d938ca18c2c9c87f24403a

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

magnum-ui is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: I9630d3da80bd79f3886bc82e891e827238925704

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

zaqar-ui is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Change-Id: Ia3f663e1271deb7a7aef6ee5fa1b17569fa5ce0e

subject: Validate image/create during cross-cell resize functional testing

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 22:43:13.000000000', 'message': 'Validate image/create during cross-cell resize functional testing

During a cross-cell resize, image-backed servers will have a
snapshot image created from the source cell instance and that
will be used to spawn the guest in the destination host. This
adds validation to the functional tests to ensure a snapshot
image is created during the resize for image-backed servers and
is also cleaned up when the resize is finished. There is no
snapshot created for volume-backed servers so for those types
of servers the test just asserts that no snapshot image was
created.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I5b59eeb8c29d3c6f13326ed2ce29212995d105ea

commit_message:
Validate image/create during cross-cell resize functional testing

During a cross-cell resize, image-backed servers will have a
snapshot image created from the source cell instance and that
will be used to spawn the guest in the destination host. This
adds validation to the functional tests to ensure a snapshot
image is created during the resize for image-backed servers and
is also cleaned up when the resize is finished. There is no
snapshot created for volume-backed servers so for those types
of servers the test just asserts that no snapshot image was
created.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I5b59eeb8c29d3c6f13326ed2ce29212995d105ea

commit_message:
Fix python3 issue in devstack plugin

Use $PYTHON to execute manage.py commands because it handles
both py2 and py3 environment.

Change-Id: I694f42db9b8110ee2b95b8132cd5ee5aa9d7357b

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Solum is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Change-Id: If6bdeb65a08e4b0329e78a23ccdb642dfd308dde

commit_message:
Support threshold type alarm again

Add threshold type alarm back. Gnocchi is not actively maintained
currently but there are still users running Ceilometer in production and
relying on Ceilometer for auditing and billing.

Change-Id: I94ea998affbdd9f5535431f3ba713e2d4662b253

commit_message:
Use cidr from tempest config project_network_v6_cidr

Tempest config project_network_v6_cidr had changed,
which cause two IPv6 IPsec site connections established
session failed.

This patch use cidrs allocated from project_network_v6_cidr.

Change-Id: Id2c06a8eb794141144dc026a8b3adfdd3ff142d5
Closes-Bug: #1852516

We switched the tripleo-container-image-prepare script in
tripleo-common, but a user will likely run the 'openstack tripleo
container image prepare' command. Currently it uses the default which is
the threading executor.

Poke tripleo common lower/requirements as well.

Change-Id: Ifc5b46633a1f9fc9378eaa17170f6664d566c3c4
Related-Bug: #1844446
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to use process executor

We switched the tripleo-container-image-prepare script in
tripleo-common, but a user will likely run the 'openstack tripleo
container image prepare' command. Currently it uses the default which is
the threading executor.

Poke tripleo common lower/requirements as well.

Change-Id: Ifc5b46633a1f9fc9378eaa17170f6664d566c3c4
Related-Bug: #1844446

commit_message:
Stop installing pydistutils.cfg

Support for easy_install codepaths is increasingly broken, and now
putting allow-hosts in this file breaks most recent pip. Just stop
installing the file - people should be using pip anyway.

Change-Id: I0a6b2432f81d80fbcbb336403fe555003880fa9f

messages:
[{'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2016-06-17 18:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2016-06-17 18:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Something I'd like to get confirmation on....the approach in this commit involves just storing the original args and then formatting the logs at the time we emit them.

If we change the variables that we're logging between the time the log message is cached and the time it's emitted, this will generate the wrong logs.  If that's the case then we either need to deep copy the args, or else format the message at the time we cache it and just cache the pre-formatted log message.

Suggestions?

Also, I'm aware of the spooling logger that Alexis Lee is working on (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316162/) but I don't think I want to depend on it before it's merged.  I think it would be simple enough to retrofit if it gets accepted."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2016-06-17 18:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see a lot of areas where the overall code could be made more efficient, but since you're just looking for feedback now, I think that this is a good start and heading in the right direction."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2016-06-17 19:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Efficiency suggestions would be welcome. :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-17 20:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

[{'created': '2016-06-17 18:39:58.000000000', 'message': 'Allow logging detailed info only on sched failure

Currently if we are logging at "info" level there is very little
information emitted if a scheduler operation fails. By comparison,
logging at "debug" level generates a large amount of logs, and most
of them aren't important.

This commit introduces a new "scheduler_detailed_log_only_on_failure"
option.  When set to "true", it will store up the scheduler filter
debug logs rather than emitting them right away or ignoring them.
If the scheduler operation fails, then the stored logs will be
emitted at the "info" log level.

If the new option is set to "false", then the behaviour will be
unchanged--the logs will be emitted right away at the "debug" log
level.

Partially implements blueprint improve-sched-logging
Co-Authored-By: Vu Tran <vu.tran@windriver.com>

Change-Id: I95804935e49ae8f67ba42370ac136039626aaa1d

commit_message:
Allow logging detailed info only on sched failure

Currently if we are logging at "info" level there is very little
information emitted if a scheduler operation fails. By comparison,
logging at "debug" level generates a large amount of logs, and most
of them aren't important.

This commit introduces a new "scheduler_detailed_log_only_on_failure"
option.  When set to "true", it will store up the scheduler filter
debug logs rather than emitting them right away or ignoring them.
If the scheduler operation fails, then the stored logs will be
emitted at the "info" log level.

If the new option is set to "false", then the behaviour will be
unchanged--the logs will be emitted right away at the "debug" log
level.

Partially implements blueprint improve-sched-logging
DocImpact: Adds a new nova config option
Co-Authored-By: Vu Tran <vu.tran@windriver.com>

Change-Id: I95804935e49ae8f67ba42370ac136039626aaa1d

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Murano is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: Iac87c01defbd7de3f14f13e5632aec899d920d1b

commit_message:
Enable recon middleware for swift account/container server

Enable recon middleware in account server and container server,
so that we can monitor metrics about swift processes related to
account or container using recon api.

Change-Id: I25d1c534c199f50c82458257d1c24196501c5499
Closes-Bug: #1852530

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-22 10:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'NetcatTester.stop_processes skip "No such process" exception

If any of the processes, client or server, spawned by NetcatTester is
not present during the stop command (kill signal sent), by default the
method will not raise an exception.

Change-Id: If8cf47a01dc353734ad07ca6cd4db7bec6c90fb6
Closes-Bug: #1852869
(cherry picked from commit 728d8ee4b1b9fd6a99ebbd66a0e30e81a078a5b5)
'}]
commit_message:
NetcatTester.stop_processes skip "No such process" exception

If any of the processes, client or server, spawned by NetcatTester is
not present during the stop command (kill signal sent), by default the
method will not raise an exception.

Change-Id: If8cf47a01dc353734ad07ca6cd4db7bec6c90fb6
Closes-Bug: #1852869
(cherry picked from commit 728d8ee4b1b9fd6a99ebbd66a0e30e81a078a5b5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-16 21:40:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update security group rule if port range is all ports

A security group rule where port_range_min:port_range_max
is 1:65535 is specifying all ports, but it is not optimal
for backends to try and implement this potentially large
rule.

Since it is essentially the entire port range, change
min:max to be None, making the rule specify the entire
protocol instead.

Change-Id: Iff22e2fc84d679e20a5a04b8516750c6ea949078
Closes-bug: #1848213
'}, {'created': '2019-10-17 19:56:51.000000000', 'message': 'Update security group rule if port range is all ports

A security group rule where port_range_min:port_range_max
is 1:65535 is specifying all ports, but it is not optimal
for backends to try and implement this potentially large

commit_message:
Update security group rule if port range is all ports

A security group rule where port_range_min:port_range_max
is 1:65535 is specifying all ports, but it is not optimal
for backends to try and implement this potentially large
rule.

Since it is essentially the entire port range, change
min:max to be None, making the rule specify the entire
protocol instead.

Change-Id: Iff22e2fc84d679e20a5a04b8516750c6ea949078
Closes-bug: #1848213

commit_message:
BugFix: FakeDirver put RC FPGA error

When cyborg-cond make sure RC FPGA exists or not, it will
try to create RC FPGA.

In fact, the format of the RC that placment-api accepts
must be CUSTOM_XXX[1]. Because FPGA RC already exists,
we don't need to create it, so skipping it directly.

[1]. https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/?expanded=update-resource-class-microversions-1-2-1-6-detail,update-resource-class-detail#create-resource-class

Story: 2006933

Change-Id: I81adaec569ff9089d26ae90602ca2265c8fa4791

commit_message:
Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-metadata to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695569
Change-Id: Ied8f7939a32bfcc6ae5563b625b438a1492a5e2c

commit_message:
Add `instance_info/kernel_append_params` to `redfish`

Adds `instance_info/kernel_append_params` property support to
`redfish` hardware type. If given, this property overrides
`[redfish]/kernel_append_params` ironic option.

The rationale for adding this property is to allow passing
node-specific kernel parameters to instance kernel.

One of the use-cases for this is to pass node static network
configuration to the kernel.

Change-Id: Ib1617f5a7ab34968d8bfe06fe49f3ba68e56f99f
Story: 2006691
Task: 36988

[{'created': '2019-11-25 18:35:46.000000000', 'message': "tools: Sort resolv.conf minikube K8s script

The way that the minikube K8s script orders a host's resolv.conf file
leaves service endpoints inaccessible from the host itself even though
they are accessible within the cluster, leaving the OpenStack client
unusable from the minikube node. This change resolves the service access
issues by reordering the DNS entries in the host's resolv.conf file.

commit_message:
tools: Sort resolv.conf minikube K8s script

The way that the minikube K8s script orders a host's resolv.conf file
leaves service endpoints inaccessible from the host itself even though
they are accessible within the cluster, leaving the OpenStack client
unusable from the minikube node. This change resolves the service access
issues by reordering the DNS entries in the host's resolv.conf file.

Change-Id: I58bf6d541e59f3049a0e350291e07241f6a6b544
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I9130a9202515ac7b88e7b6a99dbb6a756ac65895

subject: Fix vcpu_pin_set condition to resolve deployment failure
messages: [{'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-11-25 05:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-11-25 07:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2019-11-25 08:31:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-11-25 14:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-11-25 18:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 05:36:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix vcpu_pin_set condition to resolve deployment failure

In change I40e0ed0bba93bfcdc4cf157195c3e9fbcfce0776
vcpu_pin_set parameter was deprecated and superseded by
cpu_shared_set and cpu_dedicated_set parameters.

The default value for vcpu_pin_set via THT parameter
NovaComputeVcpuPinSet is [].
When NovaComputeDedicatedSet parameter is defined with
valid value (eg. ['4-12,^8,15'] then below code snippet
executes if block instead of else block even though
vcpu_pin_set is empty and raises error [1].
```
  if !empty($vcpu_pin_set) or $vcpu_pin_set != undef {
    $vcpu_pin_set_real = join(any2array($vcpu_pin_set), ',')
  } else {
    $vcpu_pin_set_real = undef
  }
```
when vcpu_pin_set is [], the if condition is true because of
expression after or operator, this change modifies the if
condition to set vcpu_pin_set_real to undef, whenever
vcpu_pin_set is either empty or undef.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/890dc6fa44b0c4475cd43ee92e37183b49e7a558/manifests/compute.pp#L281

Change-Id: I6d45683f7f5aaed15bb193252b89e5c483d3f162
Closes-Bug: #1853557
(cherry picked from commit 4cae6a6ebc3a2f7578ffa27793f6795967d902d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix vcpu_pin_set condition to resolve deployment failure

In change I40e0ed0bba93bfcdc4cf157195c3e9fbcfce0776
vcpu_pin_set parameter was deprecated and superseded by
cpu_shared_set and cpu_dedicated_set parameters.

The default value for vcpu_pin_set via THT parameter
NovaComputeVcpuPinSet is [].
When NovaComputeDedicatedSet parameter is defined with
valid value (eg. ['4-12,^8,15'] then below code snippet
executes if block instead of else block even though
vcpu_pin_set is empty and raises error [1].
```
  if !empty($vcpu_pin_set) or $vcpu_pin_set != undef {
    $vcpu_pin_set_real = join(any2array($vcpu_pin_set), ',')
  } else {
    $vcpu_pin_set_real = undef
  }
```
when vcpu_pin_set is [], the if condition is true because of
expression after or operator, this change modifies the if
condition to set vcpu_pin_set_real to undef, whenever
vcpu_pin_set is either empty or undef.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/890dc6fa44b0c4475cd43ee92e37183b49e7a558/manifests/compute.pp#L281

Change-Id: I6d45683f7f5aaed15bb193252b89e5c483d3f162
Closes-Bug: #1853557
(cherry picked from commit 4cae6a6ebc3a2f7578ffa27793f6795967d902d0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-18 17:59:55.000000000', 'message': '[RFC] Pick NEXT_MIN libvirt/QEMU versions for "V" release

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Stein" release[1].  For "Train" we didn't do any (although we
advertized).  The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions for
"Train" release were set to: libvirt 4.0.0 and QEMU 2.11.0; but we
actually didn't bump them for "Train"; we'll do that for "Ussuri".

But before we bump for "Ussuri", we need to pick NEXT_MIN versions for
the "V" release.  Based on the LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix[3], this patch
announces a version increment for libvirt and QEMU that will be applied
for the "V" release, with predicted minimum versions setting:

    libvirt to 5.0.0; and
       QEMU to 4.0.0

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b1548a988 -- libvirt:
    Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Stein", 2019-01-22
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b1548a988 -- Pick next
    minimum libvirt / QEMU versions for "T" release
[3] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Change-Id: I3d3679705dcfdd4b0ef058b40769e4c3811a1472
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pick NEXT_MIN libvirt/QEMU versions for "V" release

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Stein" release[1].  For "Train" we didn't do any (although we
advertized).  The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions for
"Train" release were set to: libvirt 4.0.0 and QEMU 2.11.0; but we
actually didn't bump them for "Train"; we'll do that for "Ussuri".

But before we bump for "Ussuri", we need to pick NEXT_MIN versions for
the "V" release.  Based on the LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix[3], this patch
announces a version increment for libvirt and QEMU that will be applied
for the "V" release, with predicted minimum versions setting:

    libvirt to 5.0.0; and
       QEMU to 4.0.0

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b1548a988 -- libvirt:
    Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Stein", 2019-01-22
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b1548a988 -- Pick next
    minimum libvirt / QEMU versions for "T" release
[3] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Change-Id: I3d3679705dcfdd4b0ef058b40769e4c3811a1472
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

subject: New Object Versioning mode
messages: [{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-11-25 18:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-11-25 22:23:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nhttps://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 18:26:53.000000000', 'message': 'New Object Versioning mode

This patch adds a new object versioning mode. This new mode provides
a new set of APIs for users to interact with older versions of an
object. It also changes the naming scheme of older versions and adds
a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older versions. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I745417ad770f79a03862808a1e5395803d6a0df0

commit_message:
New Object Versioning mode

This patch adds a new object versioning mode. This new mode provides
a new set of APIs for users to interact with older versions of an
object. It also changes the naming scheme of older versions and adds
a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older versions. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

squash this

Change-Id: I745417ad770f79a03862808a1e5395803d6a0df0

[{'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-07 03:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-07 03:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-08-07 03:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

why? did we unknowningly break something (again)?'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-07 04:51:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Artom, i'm looking at https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+bug/1839169"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-07 11:23:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

mideonet has its own vif-type const.VIF_TYPE_MIDONET
which is defined as VIF_TYPE_MIDONET = 'midonet'

if midonet only send bind time events we can update

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/network/model.py#L461-L470

to check self['type']==VIF_TYPE_MIDONET

e.g.
 return (self.is_hybrid_plug_enabled() and not
migration.is_same_host()) or self['type']==VIF_TYPE_MIDONET

that is a much more correct fix then reverting this again."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-07 11:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-08-07 11:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The errors in [1] don't look related to external events processing, which is what [2] was about.

If we make a logstash query for the failing test, we get [3]. It started failing on August 5th, whereas [2] merged on July 12th, so I don't think [2] is related to your bug. Rather, look for something that merged in the days or hours before August 5th.

[1] https://logs.opendev.org/86/673486/6/check/networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7/b919c39/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=ERROR
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667177/
[3] http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=build_name%3A%5C%22networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7%5C%22%20AND%20message%3A%5C%22line%20106%2C%20in%20test_resize_server_revert_deleted_flavor%5C%22%20AND%20tags%3A%5C%22job-output.txt%5C%22"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-08-07 11:29:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> mideonet has its own vif-type const.VIF_TYPE_MIDONET
 > which is defined as VIF_TYPE_MIDONET = 'midonet'
 > 
 > if midonet only send bind time events we can update
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/network/model.py#L461-L470
 > 
 > to check self['type']==VIF_TYPE_MIDONET
 > 
 > e.g.
 > return (self.is_hybrid_plug_enabled() and not
 > migration.is_same_host()) or self['type']==VIF_TYPE_MIDONET
 > 
 > that is a much more correct fix then reverting this again.

And anyways, if midonet has always sent bind-time events, then this was always broken, as we only changed Nova's behaviour for OVS hybrid plug, and nothing else. The job in question, networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7, is non-voting, so we'd never have noticed."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-07 11:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

for what its worth i have had 8 centos 7 devstack environment break due to python 2 packaging issues in the last 2-3 months so i think devstack on centos is not too healthy at the moment in general.

i do check non-voting job failure but if they look unrelated e.g. devstack didnt stack which is often the case in my expience i move on.

if it looks related i dig a little deeper so we might have noticed if it ran on nova.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-14 09:12:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Artom,

I'm sure the test was passing until July 12.
eg. http://logs.openstack.org/87/199387/137/check/networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7/2b25b7f/"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-08-14 12:48:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Artom,
 > 
 > I'm sure the test was passing until July 12.
 > eg. http://logs.openstack.org/87/199387/137/check/networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7/2b25b7f/

That's meaningless, because it could still have been passing *after* July 12th but before August 5th or 6th. I tried finding successful runs on Kibana, but was unable to. In fact, Kibana doens't seem to have any trace of this job before August 4th: http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=build_name%3A%5C%22networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-centos-7%5C%22"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-14 17:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/675021/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 24m 16s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-08-14 23:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-35126 : SUCCESS in 1h 54m 04s'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-08-15 01:46:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

the test passes if these changes are reverted.
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2204aa64bbb043998d51ef337caaf361

making midonet bind-time as sean suggested didn't work.
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/10e90b07304140649e79ca21a1f8db92"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-09-20 19:34:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> the test passes if these changes are reverted.
 > https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2204aa64bbb043998d51ef337caaf361

That's definitely a compelling argument, but given that the patch solved real issues with Nova, I still don't think a straight up revert is the solution. We should try to understand why Midonet doesn't work here, and come up with a solution."}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-01 01:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Artom,

networking-midonet sets port status active at bind time.
https://github.com/openstack/networking-midonet/blob/02e25cc65601add1d96b7150ed70403c3de4243b/midonet/neutron/ml2/mech_driver.py#L178
i guess it causes the event sent earlier than nova (with this change) expects.
does it explain the failure?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-10-01 23:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ill create a test job to run the midonet job against nova master to do some testing but looking at other change in the medionet review queue like this one you submited https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685798/
while the revert test failed i am seeig libvirt domain errors and a port not fond exception form invokeing mm-ctl so its not clear that those failure are related to this chagne.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-02 00:37:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

those mm-ctl errors should be harmless.
i'm not sure about libvirt domain errors."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-25 22:03:24.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This is sitting in merge conflict with no updates since October 1 and it's not clear that there was a regression so I'm just going to abandon this. If there is specific triaged problem please create a bug report for it with details and log snippets to back it up."}]

commit_message:
add backup and restore for quickstart

Before working on the overcloud environment it
would be nice if we documented how to backup
the undercloud and nodes to be able to reset
back to just prior to introspection and the deployment
of the overcloud.

Change-Id: Icaf369e0cffae5515431bf0018dbedc2fdefbc3c

commit_message:
Escape invalid JSON characters during deployment.

By first quoting the JSON query, it is possible to easily pass
it to the json_query plugin. This allows elements with special
characters, such as a hyphen -, to be resolvable.

Conflicts:
    tripleo_common/templates/deployments.yaml

Change-Id: I56f3e5f96dc25f16aed585ca6678de53721071b7
Closes-Bug: #1853321
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit f81e0bf42663b448362495c403e074af96ff3e00)

[{'created': '2019-11-14 22:41:02.000000000', 'message': 'Workarounds: remove --reverse from patch options

The --reverse option causes patch to fail even if the diff is
just few lines off.

Change-Id: I4a1459344794f5d602dc1b781d15a591ea2ac135
'}, {'created': '2019-11-18 10:09:53.000000000', 'message': "Workarounds: remove --reverse from patch options

The --reverse option causes patch to fail even if the diff is
just few lines off. The reverse option to check if patch was
applied is not a good idea with yaml. It's fairly easy to create
reverse patch for patch that wasn't applied.

commit_message:
Workarounds: remove --reverse from patch options

The --reverse option causes patch to fail even if the diff is
just few lines off. The reverse option to check if patch was
applied is not a good idea with yaml. It's fairly easy to create
reverse patch for patch that wasn't applied.

Change-Id: I4a1459344794f5d602dc1b781d15a591ea2ac135

commit_message:
Rename custom "ini" module to "validations_read_ini"

It makes name collision less possible, and should avoid some issues with
the existing "ini" lookup

Change-Id: I3af2cf16fdea5a46748ff828c9d9b5844019de1c
(cherry picked from commit d749c1a1c65d90b08565a88905a826f197ab408b)

subject: Ensure "network" service is enabled
messages: [{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-11-25 09:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-11-25 12:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-11-25 15:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 09:53:34.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure "network" service is enabled

It may happen this service isn't enabled (especially on newer
Centos/RHEL releases), leading in network misconfigurations.

Ensuring it's actually enabled allows br-ctlplane to get configured upon
reboot.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1774581
Change-Id: I4a56d837e08498bc4d25d25c7203bfd7d012974e
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 804dd0f341ac63e8c6029cab76d0ac316df24261)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure "network" service is enabled

It may happen this service isn't enabled (especially on newer
Centos/RHEL releases), leading in network misconfigurations.

Ensuring it's actually enabled allows br-ctlplane to get configured upon
reboot.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1774581
Change-Id: I4a56d837e08498bc4d25d25c7203bfd7d012974e
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 804dd0f341ac63e8c6029cab76d0ac316df24261)

commit_message:
Call Glance list with certain image ids

This patch uses glance list filtering, which allow to query images
for the list of required ids. See [1] for details.

Patch rebased to master. Added test for proposed Glance API request

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/#show-images

Related-Bug: #1508554
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Co-Authored-By: Vadym Markov <markov.vadim@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
(cherry picked from commit deb55b8411434b32a2ea92f1a825e7dea36deea5)

commit_message:
Escape invalid JSON characters during deployment.

By first quoting the JSON query, it is possible to easily pass
it to the json_query plugin. This allows elements with special
characters, such as a hyphen -, to be resolvable.

Change-Id: I56f3e5f96dc25f16aed585ca6678de53721071b7
Closes-Bug: #1853321
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e028953d0b1507f0c048bddf0d5cedab69f4bfbe)

commit_message:
Escape invalid JSON characters during deployment.

By first quoting the JSON query, it is possible to easily pass
it to the json_query plugin. This allows elements with special
characters, such as a hyphen -, to be resolvable.

Conflicts:
    tripleo_common/templates/deployments.yaml

Change-Id: I56f3e5f96dc25f16aed585ca6678de53721071b7
Closes-Bug: #1853321
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7cebd8b3e1100890ff6d6ec82922cac608055e7d)

commit_message:
Enable "port_forwarding" feature in neutron ML2 ovs environment

This patch enables port_forwarding service plugin and L3 agent's
extension in case of ML2/OVS environment.
It don't enable it in ML2/OVN cases as networking-ovn don't support
port_forwarding yet.

This patch also adds NeutronL3AgentExtensions config option for
Neutron L3 agent.
This new option is used to enable "port_forwarding" extension on L3
agent.

Conflicts:
    deployment/neutron/neutron-l3-container-puppet.yaml
    environments/services/neutron-ovs.yaml

Change-Id: I2417f9f6a436ae7a3820e16fdf6210099807b651
(cherry picked from commit 95f889720c2f7e8467cc0f488ad0176dcafffe6a)

commit_message:
Escape invalid JSON characters during deployment.

By first quoting the JSON query, it is possible to easily pass
it to the json_query plugin. This allows elements with special
characters, such as a hyphen -, to be resolvable.

Conflicts:
    tripleo_common/templates/deployments.yaml

Change-Id: I56f3e5f96dc25f16aed585ca6678de53721071b7
Closes-Bug: #1853321
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c2a83c1cd5e8cc9cb04432e9bc8f37793c02f0c7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-23 13:40:09.000000000', 'message': 'Improve stonith leves idempotency.

This commit improves the way stonith levels are set up and their
resiliency against redeployments by introducing a stonith_levels
custom fact that collects the current stonith levels defined for
the specific server, so we can compare against the desired number
of levels defined in hiera.

If these do not match (for example if there are additional levels
that are no longer necessary), the clean up step also introduced
by this commit takes care of deleting the ones no longer necessary.

Change-Id: Ifae73ac2bf4481d0a11e89c0ea0916e85dd2db1d
(cherry picked from commit 7c30bd791fd5a9a5ee00003709752b057e3d86c8)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve stonith leves idempotency.

This commit improves the way stonith levels are set up and their
resiliency against redeployments by introducing a stonith_levels
custom fact that collects the current stonith levels defined for
the specific server, so we can compare against the desired number
of levels defined in hiera.

If these do not match (for example if there are additional levels
that are no longer necessary), the clean up step also introduced
by this commit takes care of deleting the ones no longer necessary.

Change-Id: Ifae73ac2bf4481d0a11e89c0ea0916e85dd2db1d
(cherry picked from commit 7c30bd791fd5a9a5ee00003709752b057e3d86c8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 10:08:23.000000000', 'message': 'Readd some QEMU distro packages

Had issues where QEMU packages were not in sync and got an error:
... Note: only modules from the same build can be loaded. ...
The qemu package no longer lists dependencies on qemu-system, qemu-user,
qemu-utils in apt show.
Qemu-utils is recommended by other packages but I am unsure as to whether
this will guarantee an upgrade in all circumstances.
While qemu-system does list dependencies on the arm, mips, ppc... packages
they are unversioned and therefore do not keep in step.

Change-Id: I8ea4681a58a54bdc6a24ff053b11dfee5cc7af59
(cherry picked from commit 149d555d6b19ccfd903fff2797d901bfa3a0c69f)
'}]
commit_message:
Readd some QEMU distro packages

Had issues where QEMU packages were not in sync and got an error:
... Note: only modules from the same build can be loaded. ...
The qemu package no longer lists dependencies on qemu-system, qemu-user,
qemu-utils in apt show.
Qemu-utils is recommended by other packages but I am unsure as to whether
this will guarantee an upgrade in all circumstances.
While qemu-system does list dependencies on the arm, mips, ppc... packages
they are unversioned and therefore do not keep in step.

Change-Id: I8ea4681a58a54bdc6a24ff053b11dfee5cc7af59
(cherry picked from commit 149d555d6b19ccfd903fff2797d901bfa3a0c69f)

needs a change to the api service def'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-06-25 07:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> Are you suggesting we should put the agent in the same container 

Surely octavia design is not good for containerized services. 

Octavia release note[1] has this:

"The Stein release of Octavia adds the driver-agent controller process. This process is deployed along with the Octavia API process and uses unix domain sockets for communication between the provider drivers using octavia-lib and the driver-agent."

IMO, adding the driver-agent container to octavia api service (I guess we can have multiple containers that can be started/managed in order in a service), rather than creating a new service would be better. This would at least ensure that both end up on the same node, though we still have to mount /var/run/octvia for the socket in both containers.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/octavia/stein.html'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-06-27 15:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> > Are you suggesting we should put the agent in the same container
 > 
 > Surely octavia design is not good for containerized services.
 > 
 > Octavia release note[1] has this:
 > 
 > "The Stein release of Octavia adds the driver-agent controller
 > process. This process is deployed along with the Octavia API
 > process and uses unix domain sockets for communication between the
 > provider drivers using octavia-lib and the driver-agent."
 > 
 > IMO, adding the driver-agent container to octavia api service (I
 > guess we can have multiple containers that can be started/managed
 > in order in a service), rather than creating a new service would be
 > better. This would at least ensure that both end up on the same
 > node, though we still have to mount /var/run/octvia for the socket
 > in both containers.
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/octavia/stein.html

Okay. This was something that was discussed. I'd like someone from the Octavia squad to chime in with the justification for the separate agent. The only thing the definitely comes to mind at present if the agent is simply not needed (i.e. you are only using the amphora driver) then it can be removed from the deployment.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-06-27 15:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-06-27 17:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Good points from both, thank you!

Just to set some context for others also reviewing. Currently, the API can function together with the amphora provider driver without needing the driver agent to be present anywhere. For third-party provider drivers, the driver agent is required. At some point in Train or later, the amphora driver will also talk to the API via the driver agent just like other drivers must have to.

Now, I think running the driver agent outside the API container is better thinking about Octavia roadmap. The communication driver agent -> API is today via UNIX domain socket, which requires collocation within the same system but not within the same container. The Octavia team would like to move away from UNIX domain socket to REST meaning it would become plausible to run the two services on different nodes (composable roles).

Adding the driver agent container to the Octavia API *TripleO service*, prevents operators from running them on different nodes, which would fail to operate, sounds reasonable to me for Stein and until the move to REST-based communication.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-06-27 18:26:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Allow me to clarify my stance: either one of the two approaches is fine IMO. I'd just argue against collocating both processes (API and driver agent) in the same container."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-27 18:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

If the agent is a process, it would be a new container but defined in the same tripleo service (to ensure colocation).  We might be able to do some heat if condition in the octavia service to allow for it to be enabled/disabled as necessary but live in the existing service definition.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-06-27 18:55:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> If the agent is a process, it would be a new container but defined
 > in the same tripleo service (to ensure colocation).  We might be
 > able to do some heat if condition in the octavia service to allow
 > for it to be enabled/disabled as necessary but live in the existing
 > service definition.

MMm.. yeah that could work. Might actually work a bit better to start with because we could conditionally deploy it by default based on mechanism driver list. I'll try it out."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-08-30 19:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-08-30 19:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Add Octavia driver agent service

Initial addition of the octavia driver agent service which is required
for the Octavia OVN provider.

Change-Id: Iddfbb649b3161a69a7d9a4a81b6913919d307d01

commit_message:
Make sure we apply all deploy step-0 during update.

That step include, in particular, the puppet-container.py/sh creation
file plus some other task that should happen very early during the
deploy process.

During update if a change in puppet-container.py happen in the
template we have to trigger those steps to get the changes.  This is
especially critical because we run puppet container configuration
during the update stage.

Patch slighly adjusted for the backport as step_1 refactoring doesn't
exist in stein and neither does container-puppet.sh.

Closes-Bug: #1853156
Change-Id: I26406da82c584dc5093c17ad26f263057a5cbcaa
(cherry picked from commit 10a523a03d6c6883015e620de52c64b85d20a188)
(cherry picked from commit 3c71c99d7c843ac87616621a4eb084b0852b65f8)

Putting a hold on this until we can discuss at the PTG.

My concern about removing py2 testing from master is that it could allow py3-only constructs to get into the codebase, and I really don't think we want that to happen while we have any branch open for backports that supports py2.  Or we can have a policy that broadens the nature of the kind of backports we will accept (i.e., not simply a cherry-pick with some merge conflicts resolved, but possibly a very different fix).  We can work this out at the PTG."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-24 23:21:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Drop python 2 testing

This drops py2 testing as we switch to py3-only in Ussuri. This is the
first step towards a py3-only codebase. Additional cleanup work will be
done later for compatibility code that is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I56e9cefd88e72d2da55fd36e70e0b7a47cfc3767
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Add functional regression test for bug 1849409

Difference from the stein change is noted in the commit message, stein change has merged, LGTM. Proxying Matt's backport as a stable core as a +2."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-10-26 06:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow

Hm, both this patch and the patch on top of it failed the functional jobs with race condition issues (I assume). I wonder if there was some improvement to the func tests in >= stein that we need to pull in underneath these patches to avoid the racing.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-10-26 06:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hm, both this patch and the patch on top of it failed the
 > functional jobs with race condition issues (I assume). I wonder if
 > there was some improvement to the func tests in >= stein that we
 > need to pull in underneath these patches to avoid the racing.

Correction: functional tests only failed on this patch, not the one above it.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-28 13:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Something is leaking into this test somehow.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-28 13:40:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It looks like the API DB is leaking through between tests somehow and I'm wondering if there is a global in play. Looking at the Database fixture there is a global DB_SCHEMA and some of that changed with Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593 in Stein but we can't backport that."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-28 13:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looking at those two tests, it looks like the first runs here:

2019-10-26 05:21:36.766164 | ubuntu-xenial | {1} nova.tests.functional.regressions.test_bug_1780373.TestMultiCreateServerGroupMemberOverQuota.test_concurrent_request_server_group_members_over_quota [2.887971s] ... ok

and the failed one runs on the same worker:

If they are actually sharing the same API DB, maybe the 2nd test runs before the first is fully cleaned up because the first doesn't delete its resources and wait for them to be gone. I am able to recreate locally doing this:

$ tox -e functional-py36 -- --serial "test_concurrent_request_server_group_members_over_quota|test_list_deleted_servers_with_marker"'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-28 14:28:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 19:34:17.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression test for bug 1849409

Change I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab in Queens,
which was backported through to Newton, introduced a regression
when listing deleted servers with a marker because it assumes
that if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters does not raise
MarkerNotFound that the marker was found among the build requests
and does not account for that get_by_filters method short-circuiting
if filtering servers with deleted/cleaned/limit=0. The API code
then nulls out the marker which means you'll continue to get the
marker instance back in the results even though you shouldn't,
and that can cause an infinite loop in some client-side tooling like
nova's CLI:

  nova list --deleted --limit -1

This adds a functional recreate test for the regression which will
be updated when the bug is fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): In this backport we get the PlacementFixture from
the usual nova_fixtures import since change
Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593 is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I324193129acb6ac739133c7e76920762a8987a84
Related-Bug: #1849409

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1849409

Change I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab in Queens,
which was backported through to Newton, introduced a regression
when listing deleted servers with a marker because it assumes
that if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters does not raise
MarkerNotFound that the marker was found among the build requests
and does not account for that get_by_filters method short-circuiting
if filtering servers with deleted/cleaned/limit=0. The API code
then nulls out the marker which means you'll continue to get the
marker instance back in the results even though you shouldn't,
and that can cause an infinite loop in some client-side tooling like
nova's CLI:

  nova list --deleted --limit -1

This adds a functional recreate test for the regression which will
be updated when the bug is fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): In this backport we get the PlacementFixture from
the usual nova_fixtures import since change
Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593 is not in Rocky. Also,
test_concurrent_request_server_group_members_over_quota leaks deleted
servers from cell0 for some reason in Rocky which can make this test
intermittently fail. This is not a problem after Rocky for some reason.
To avoid intermittent failures due to that leak, the test is modified
to filter on the name of the server created in the test only.

Change-Id: I324193129acb6ac739133c7e76920762a8987a84
Related-Bug: #1849409
(cherry picked from commit 45c2752f2ce08b314012eff044b01aa7d626b43d)
(cherry picked from commit 727d942b2830fb6970d99507f2b5eb1a28df01b2)
(cherry picked from commit 47caaccd4a03660d7df144f2eadd821d36baeaa8)

commit_message:
Don't delete compute node, when deleting service other than nova-compute

We should not try to delete compute node from compute_nodes table,
when destroying service other than nova-compute.

Change-Id: If5b5945e699ec2e2da51d5fa90616431274849b0
Closes-Bug: #1852993
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
(cherry picked from commit cff9ecb20870daa56b1cfd6fbb9f5817d1306fda)
(cherry picked from commit 716cde5454a5cd527040c60dbfd2b6ed37a1975c)

commit_message:
vPMU tests

This patch introduces Virtual Performance Monitoring Unit tests.
Booting a VM with and without vPMUs is tested implicitly as part of
rebuild and resize test cases.

Related: blueprint libvirt-pmu-configuration
Change-Id: Icceeb548264c0cecf6ae588fe368f4905dd3f646

commit_message:
Mock out the correct greenthread sleep method

It seems at some point oslo_service loopingcall started using
eventletutils from oslo_utils to sleep during the loopingcall
retries, and some untittests started taking up to 40 seconds
to complete. This change mocks out the correct method offering
significant speedup to unittests' run time.

The EventletEvent class is introduced to eventletutils in version
3.38.0 so lower constraints are bumped as well.

Change-Id: Id7e6ff2a4748b5301e2259acdc760ac7f56b96c3

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

metalsmith is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: Icf19488a3f230084faaf2ab5ece626b03495592e

commit_message:
Bump up ipa-ip-lookup-attempts to 6

To accommodate network setup that takes longer then
30 seconds increase the number of IP lookup attempts. This
allows for IPv6 setup that occurs after DHCP has time out.

Change-Id: I1351e150a63c6247210ca0cbc8ce0abfe82129cd
(cherry picked from commit c4bb6940825519dd62574f932ae3a01f49685e33)

Tests mostly run in parallel now, but this is not perfect yet. Set
concurrency to 1 until relatd bug is properly fixed

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-14 23:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm sure there was already plenty of bikeshedding to come up with "--no-provider" as a name for this option, so I won't downvote on it, but coming into this fresh, I don't like it at all. Even in coordination with other --no-* opts, it more implies that we're either getting rid of or ignoring the provider than that we're specifically targeting its allocations. There must be a better option. "--clear-provider"? "--empty-provider"?

However, I am going to downvote for the missing consumer generation, at least until that behavior is validated in a live environment. If we want to defer support for 1.28+ that's one thing, but then we shouldn't recommend using it.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 14:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

> I'm sure there was already plenty of bikeshedding to come up with "--no-provider" as a name for this option, so I won't downvote on it, but coming into this fresh, I don't like it at all. Even in coordination with other --no-* opts, it more implies that we're either getting rid of or ignoring the provider than that we're specifically targeting its allocations. There must be a better option. "--clear-provider"? "--empty-provider"?

I have some notes in the linked story about options. I originally wanted to do "openstack resource provider allocation delete --provider <provider_id> <consumer_id>" but the delete CLI doesn't print anything out like the set CLI does and I thought changing that would be weirder than updating set since I think the primary use case for this change is removing one or more but not all providers from the allocations for a given consumer. If you want to remove them all, you'd use the allocation delete CLI. We handle DELETE here just in case the caller is confused or loses a race or something.

Another option I've kicked around is adding a new "openstack resource provider allocation unset --provider <provider_id> <consumer_id>" command. If we did that, I think --provider would be required and I don't think I'd want to get into the mess of adding a --no-allocation to an unset command (the OSC pattern seems to be set --thing, unset --no-thing). So what do people think about adding an unset command where one or more provider is required rather than munging this into the set command where either --allocation or --no-provider is required?

Or alternatively change the name on this option to be more clear, e.g. --remove-provider, --clear-provider, etc? I don't know how Dean would feel about that so I'd want to ask him.

> However, I am going to downvote for the missing consumer generation, at least until that behavior is validated in a live environment. If we want to defer support for 1.28+ that's one thing, but then we shouldn't recommend using it.

I will add a test for 1.28 but I think it's going to be OK because GET and PUT are mirroring the consumer_generation parameter.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 14:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 14:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 14:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:11:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

OK PS5 handles the consumer_generation stuff. I'm posting it just so y'all can see the difference.

Two questions remain:

1. Should I split out the 1.28 consumer_generation stuff into a separate change before this? It's probably easy enough to do.

2. Naming; should we:

a) continue to use the set command but change the name of the option to --clear-provider or --remove-provider or

b) use a new unset command with a --provider option

I'm a bit inclined to (a) since then I wouldn't have to duplicate the consumer generation and a lot of the code between the commands and also side-step questions about if an unset command should have a --no-allocation option or something that allows removing specific resource classes from an existing allocation (that would be annoying to deal with on a CLI)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:57:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

In reverse order:

> 2. Naming; should we:
> a) continue to use the set command but change the name of the option to --clear-provider or --remove-provider or
> b) use a new unset command with a --provider option

I prefer some variant of the latter. Have we sullied 'set' with any other partial-update stuff yet? If not, I would say we should try to leave 'set' as full overwrite and put partial updates in a different subcommand.

> duplicate the consumer generation and a lot of the code between the commands

Helper methods

> if an unset command should have a --no-allocation option

If it's unset, you don't really need 'no-' IMO. Something like

 openstack resource provider allocation unset [--provider P] [--resource-class R1 [--resource-class R2 ...]] $consumer

With none of the optional args, it's basically the same as delete. Otherwise you're narrowing to a specific provider and/or resource class(es).

Another option is a patch-like command (resource provider allocation update?) that lets you add/remove pieces granularly. But that would be a bear to design -- just use `set`.

> 1. Should I split out the 1.28 consumer_generation stuff into a separate change before this? It's probably easy enough to do.

If you're doing a new subcommand, yes; if you can talk me into leaving this stuff on `set`, nah, just leave it folded in."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-15 18:16:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

In IRC [1] we agreed on 

 openstack resource provider allocation unset [--provider $rp_uuid ...] $consumer_uuid

where --provider is repeatable, and we can later add (repeatable) --resource-class $rcname. The effect is limited to the provider(s) (and resource class(es)) specified, or all if you don't specify any.

That being the case, it would be nice to add 1.28 support for `set` in a separate patch. Though it is of questionable value to the end user because of the shortness of the window between GET and PUT, today it will simply fail.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2019-11-15.log.html#t2019-11-15T14:13:27"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-15 19:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-19 17:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-19 17:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

I'll revisit this after the next one."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-25 10:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

The next patch looks good to me as well.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-25 17:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

``openstack resource provider allocation set`` command which is mutually

resource provider from the set of allocations for the given consumer.

A new ``--no-provider`` option is added to the
``openstack resource provider allocation set`` command which is mutually
exclusive with the ``--allocation`` option and will allow removing
reource providers from the set of allocations for the given consumer.
This can be useful when a consumer has allocations against more than one
resource provider and ``openstack resource provider allocation delete``
is undesirable as it removes all allocations for the consumer.

Note that --no-provider can be specified multiple times.

Also, if the resulting allocations are all gone, a DELETE is called rather
than PUT since PUT /allocations/{consumer_id} does not allow an empty
"allocations" dict in the request body. In this case nothing is output
similar to the "openstack resource provider allocation delete" command.

Change-Id: I627bfd1ff699d075028da6afafbe7fb9b2f13058
Story: #2006779
Task: #37304

Note that --no-provider can be specified multiple times.

If the resulting allocations are all gone and 1.28 or greater is not

commit_message:
Add resource provider allocation unset command

Adds the "openstack resource provider allocation unset" command which
allows removing resource provider(s) from the set of allocations for
the given consumer. This can be useful when a consumer has allocations
against more than one resource provider and
"openstack resource provider allocation delete" is undesirable as it
removes all allocations for the consumer. The new unset command requires
"--os-placement-api-version 1.12" or greater.

Note that the --provider option can be specified multiple times.

If the resulting allocations are all gone and 1.28 or greater is not
being used, a DELETE is called rather than PUT since
PUT /allocations/{consumer_id} before 1.28 does not allow an empty
"allocations" dict in the request body. In this case nothing is output
similar to the "openstack resource provider allocation delete" command.

Change-Id: I627bfd1ff699d075028da6afafbe7fb9b2f13058
Story: #2006779
Task: #37304

In an environment where ironic is disabled, but IPA images are built
locally for the seed, the following task will fail in a number of
commands, e.g. kayobe overcloud service deploy:

Validate the presence of locally built Ironic Python Agent (IPA) images

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

(cherry picked from commit b05fc00dcf059ce961eb1355b359b443883cb17f)

commit_message:
Fix validation of locally built IPA when ironic is disabled

In an environment where ironic is disabled, but IPA images are built
locally for the seed, the following task will fail in a number of
commands, e.g. kayobe overcloud service deploy:

Validate the presence of locally built Ironic Python Agent (IPA) images

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

Change-Id: I61067164a003bcdf6079cdaca36f0e1755186f60
Story: 2006669
Task: 36935
(cherry picked from commit b05fc00dcf059ce961eb1355b359b443883cb17f)

commit_message:
Fix validation of locally built IPA when ironic is disabled

In an environment where ironic is disabled, but IPA images are built
locally for the seed, the following task will fail in a number of
commands, e.g. kayobe overcloud service deploy:

Validate the presence of locally built Ironic Python Agent (IPA) images

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

Change-Id: I61067164a003bcdf6079cdaca36f0e1755186f60
Story: 2006669
Task: 36935
(cherry picked from commit b05fc00dcf059ce961eb1355b359b443883cb17f)

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

Change-Id: I61067164a003bcdf6079cdaca36f0e1755186f60
Story: 2006669
Task: 36935
(cherry picked from commit b05fc00dcf059ce961eb1355b359b443883cb17f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validation of locally built IPA when ironic is disabled

In an environment where ironic is disabled, but IPA images are built
locally for the seed, the following task will fail in a number of
commands, e.g. kayobe overcloud service deploy:

Validate the presence of locally built Ironic Python Agent (IPA) images

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

Change-Id: I61067164a003bcdf6079cdaca36f0e1755186f60
Story: 2006669
Task: 36935
(cherry picked from commit b05fc00dcf059ce961eb1355b359b443883cb17f)

commit_message:
docs: update the local development quickstart to use JSON RPC

No need to make everyone install rabbitmq just to play with ironic.
Also make it clearer that MySQL is not required.

Change-Id: Ib286f30f16579815ca05c8477f7fd446cad6e453

[{'created': '2019-11-16 16:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports

The nova-api checks at each move* operation if the instance has qos port
attached as not all the move operations are supported for such servers.
Nova uses the request context to initialize the neutron client for the
port query. However neutron does not return the value of the
resource_request of the port if it is queried with a non admin client.
This causes that if the move operation is initiated by a non admin
then nova thinks that the ports do not have resource request.

This patch creates an admin context for this neutron query.

The new functional tests are not added before this patch in a regression
test like way as existing functional tests are reused with different
setup and doing that without the fix causes a lot of different failure
scenarios.

Note that neutron fixture is changed to simulate the different behavior
in case of different request context are used to initialize the client.

   for evacuate in Ussuri but exists in Train and Stein.

commit_message:
Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports

The nova-api checks at each move* operation if the instance has qos port
attached as not all the move operations are supported for such servers.
Nova uses the request context to initialize the neutron client for the
port query. However neutron does not return the value of the
resource_request of the port if it is queried with a non admin client.
This causes that if the move operation is initiated by a non admin
then nova thinks that the ports do not have resource request.

This patch creates an admin context for this neutron query.

The new functional tests are not added before this patch in a regression
test like way as existing functional tests are reused with different
setup and doing that without the fix causes a lot of different failure
scenarios.

Note that neutron fixture is changed to simulate the different behavior
in case of different request context are used to initialize the client.

*: Note that Id5f2f4f22b856c989e2eef8ed56b9829d1bcefb6 removed the check
   for evacuate in Ussuri but exists in Train and Stein.

Conflicts:
  nova/api/openstack/common.py due to
  I6fc3cb0651f65b2448fbbb58989c920974f076c3 is missing

  nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py
  nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_migrate_server.py
  due to I09cac780b9ee5b5726874d4e6f895fd0cd4bff8c is missing

  nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py
  due to Ib1a73f5e20b6f9a325d8b24d9253a18f2a46db1f and
  Id0ee10e8d323786f4d79c82e3f05b48e76bd0956 is missing

  nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_actions.py
  due to Ib1a73f5e20b6f9a325d8b24d9253a18f2a46db1f is missing

  nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py due to
  I6381365ff882cf23808e8dabfce41143c5e35192 is missing

Also integrated_helpers.py and test_servers.py needed to be changed due
to Id0ee10e8d323786f4d79c82e3f05b48e76bd0956 is missing. As well as
NonAdminUnsupportedPortResourceRequestBasedSchedulingTest.setUp() needed
to be extended to allow calling migrate and resize for the non admin api
client.

Change-Id: I3cf6eb4654663865d9258c38f05cd05974ffcf9d
Closes-Bug: #1850280
(cherry picked from commit 899976960503524b8e5c6588e339742ca4bf8158)
(cherry picked from commit 4cb493fe4f79e736ae4fd7874b02d1d5ceed02c1)

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

tenks is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

commit_message:
CI/Debian: Push images after building

This fixes Debian job failures during image building.

See https://github.com/docker/for-linux/issues/711
for upstream details.

Change-Id: Icf3ffb261605ffe5d8f2618c2ed4cb97db97dd49

subject: Add support for microversion 1.28 in allocation set
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-19 17:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-21 12:12:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks. LGTM overall.
Just one point on L149: Don't we want to display the updated consumer generation?"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-21 12:17:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is just a note… we have 4 APIs changed in 1.28

PUT\xa0/allocations/{consumer_uuid}\xa0->  Done in this (and the previous) patch
POST\xa0/allocations -> API not implemented in client 
GET\xa0/allocations/{consumer_uuid} -> Can be done in this or another patch later.
GET\xa0/resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations -> Done without any changes (see the following)

$ openstack resource provider show $test1 --allocations --os-placement-api-version=1.28
+----------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Field                | Value                                                                                              |
+----------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| uuid                 | b52ae3a3-d70b-4b03-a21b-163a0c732aff                                                               |
| name                 | test1                                                                                              |
| generation           | 4                                                                                                  |
| root_provider_uuid   | b52ae3a3-d70b-4b03-a21b-163a0c732aff                                                               |
| parent_provider_uuid | None                                                                                               |
| allocations          | {u'8b375eda-a233-4c31-96fe-b13f0021ea31': {u'consumer_generation': 3, u'resources': {u'VCPU': 4}}} |
+----------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-21 14:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-21 14:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-22 01:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-22 06:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-11-25 10:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

It looks like only ``openstack resource provider aggregate set`` accepts the resource provider generation and we could expose resource provider and/or consumer generation for following APIs, 

* openstack resource provider inventory set
* openstack resource provider allocation set

...but since whether to use generation or not can be a user's choice, we can do it later optionally if more strict handling is needed, so this looks good to me."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-25 16:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I looked at these out of order.

This one looks okay to me, but let me come back to it after looking at the predecessor.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-25 17:10:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

predecessor is good, let's go."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-19 17:45:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for microversion 1.28 in allocation set

This adds support to the resource provider allocation set command
for microversion 1.28 which uses consumer generations to ensure
atomic updates of consumer allocations.

Change-Id: I8f85ee4ff4c39fba69a78bbe642f79a706504df8
Story: #2006912
Task: #37557
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for microversion 1.28 in allocation set

This adds support to the resource provider allocation set command
for microversion 1.28 which uses consumer generations to ensure
atomic updates of consumer allocations.

Change-Id: I8f85ee4ff4c39fba69a78bbe642f79a706504df8
Story: #2006912
Task: #37557

commit_message:
api-guide: flesh out todos in user doc

This is pretty basic. As for the todo about using named
personas I've just removed that since I don't think at
this point anyone is going to work on assigning names like
Bob and Sally to roles in the guide and consistently use them.

Change-Id: I88dfb23c0e2750dc37d32dfc431b62baed7238b6
