- gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-trusty-extras-nv http://logs.openstack.org/79/414179/1/check/gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-trusty-extras-nv/5901cce/ : SUCCESS in 31m 58s (non-voting)
- gate-dib-dsvm-functests-centos-7-extras-nv http://logs.openstack.org/79/414179/1/check/gate-dib-dsvm-functests-centos-7-extras-nv/82acc5b/ : SUCCESS in 35m 00s (non-voting)
- gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-xenial-extras-nv http://logs.openstack.org/79/414179/1/check/gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-xenial-extras-nv/2ff4b8b/ : FAILURE in 1m 54s (non-voting)
- gate-dsvm-nodepool-debian-src-nv http://logs.openstack.org/79/414179/1/check/gate-dsvm-nodepool-debian-src-nv/42816f9/ : FAILURE in 56m 07s (non-voting)
- gate-dsvm-nodepool-redhat-src-nv http://logs.openstack.org/79/414179/1/check/gate-dsvm-nodepool-redhat-src-nv/bfd7fb4/ : FAILURE in 56m 27s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-22 15:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed (check-tripleo pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing


- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-nonha http://logs.openstack.org/79/414179/1/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-nonha/ba2c45a/ : FAILURE in 1h 01m 51s'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-01-10 04:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

OK, I'd agree there is a problem.  However, it seems we've got calls out there that don't pre-call dib-init-system [1]; i.e. backwards compatibility.

After a bit of back-and-forth ... what I'm thinking is that maybe 10-dib-init-system.bash should have an "if" statement that checks the current phase and only sets it in the chroot phases where we expect it to be available [2]?  in other phases it can set it to "error" or something which should, at least in theory, trigger the "else"/default clauses of anyone matching on this output?

of course an additional complication in this is that i don't think there's info available about what the current phase is; but for environment files that actually seems like reasonable info to have because they are sourced in all contexts.  so i'd support something like DIB_RUN_PHASE being exported in run_d() function (basically just TMP_HOOKS_PATH?)

urgh

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=DIB_INIT_SYSTEM&i=nope&files=&repos=
[2] for "expect to be available" being a definition we create as of now'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-01-10 08:52:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Uups...

1) I think I understand your hint.
2) Things are much more complicated:
What should happen if DIB_INIT_SYSTEM is set in the environment.d phase of a chroot-phase as you propose and then some element (like debian-upstart) decides to change the init system?

I see two possible solutions:

A) diskimage-builder and all elements (internal and external) must completely install the init system during the 'root.d' phase. During this phase DIB_INIT_SYSTEM is not available. This must be documented. The remaining phases can be handled as you propose.

B) We create a function that stores a 'init-system-backlog'. At the end of the build process (just before unmounting) this backlog is executed based on the installed init system.

My idea is that B) is more complex but also more robust: in A) every element can execute a 'apt-get remove ...' and 'apt-get add ...' to change the init system and it is mostly impossible to check this automatically.

Any ideas?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-13 06:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-01-13 18:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-01-13 18:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Resolved merge conflict; rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-13 18:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

I think youre on the right track with let the OS elements handle this (since they are the ones who will know the init system). We could probably simplify the solution a lot if we simply have the OS elements export the var in env.d based on config. 

e.g. if [ DIB_RELEASE=trusty ]; then export DIB_INIT_SYSTEM=upstart; else export DIB_INIT_SYSTEM=systemd; fi

Its definitely a bit of boilerplate but I think itll be less code than some of the more complex solutions, and also its pretty simple to understand.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-08 11:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

I rather like this.  That guessing has always been troublesome'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-04-04 04:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Actually, thinking on this some more, and in light of the problem caused by I9eaceefb6bd327df5d78066106ba88fe1c44c778 where removing postfix removed redhat-lsb-core, which also removed lsb_release and made this stop working ... 

Maybe we should just centralise the setting into dib-init-system itself, with just hard-coded paths for DISTRO.  The important bit being and "else" clause that fails with a nice exit status when we don't know what to do

the other choice being leave it like this, but have a similar check in dib-init-system that looks for DIB_INIT_SYSTEM being set, and if it isn't complains that you need to set it.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-04-04 04:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

also, elements out there call "dib-init-system"

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-22 14:43:50.000000000', 'message': 'Move evaluation of init system to chroot phases

The previous implementation evaluates the dib-init-system too early:
first time it is evaluated on the host (which should not be).
Later on it is evaluated during the `environment.d` phase. At this
phase the init system of the generated VM might even not be installed
(as e.g. for Debian Stretch).

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'created': '2017-01-13 18:09:23.000000000', 'message': 'Move evaluation of init system to chroot phases

The previous implementation evaluates the dib-init-system too early:
first time it is evaluated on the host (which should not be).
Later on it is evaluated during the `environment.d` phase. At this
phase the init system of the generated VM might even not be installed
(as e.g. for Debian Stretch).

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'created': '2017-04-02 18:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce manual setting of DIB_INIT_SYSTEM

The current implementation evauates the dib-init-system
script too early.  Also it looks that there is no simple
way of getting the info about the init system automatically:
another element can install (later on) a different
init system.  Therefore the only reliable way of setting
this is manual.

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'created': '2017-04-04 05:02:10.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce manual setting of DIB_INIT_SYSTEM

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce manual setting of DIB_INIT_SYSTEM

The current implementation evauates the dib-init-system
script too early.  Also it looks that there is no simple
way of getting the info about the init system automatically:
another element can install (later on) a different
init system.  Therefore the only reliable way of setting
this is manual.

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Don't delete compute node, when deleting service other than nova-compute

We should not try to delete compute node from compute_nodes table,
when destroying service other than nova-compute.

Change-Id: If5b5945e699ec2e2da51d5fa90616431274849b0
Closes-Bug: #1852993
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-11-20 21:35:33.000000000', 'message': "Prometheus: Update chart to support federation

This updates the Prometheus chart to support federation. This
moves to defining the Prometheus configuration file via a template
in the values.yaml file instead of through raw yaml. This allows
for overriding the chart's default configuration wholesale, as
this would be required for a hierarchical federated setup. This
also strips out all of the default rules defined in the chart for
the same reason. There are example rules defined for the various
aspects of OSH's infrastructure in the prometheus/values_overrides
directory that are executed as part of the normal CI jobs. This
also adds a nonvoting federated-monitoring job that vets out the
ability to federate prometheus in a hierarchical fashion with
extremely basic overrides

Change-Id: I0f121ad5e4f80be4c790dc869955c6b299ca9f26
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-11-21 12:39:56.000000000', 'message': "Prometheus: Update chart to support federation

This updates the Prometheus chart to support federation. This
moves to defining the Prometheus configuration file via a template
in the values.yaml file instead of through raw yaml. This allows
for overriding the chart's default configuration wholesale, as
this would be required for a hierarchical federated setup. This
also strips out all of the default rules defined in the chart for
the same reason. There are example rules defined for the various
aspects of OSH's infrastructure in the prometheus/values_overrides
directory that are executed as part of the normal CI jobs. This
also adds a nonvoting federated-monitoring job that vets out the
ability to federate prometheus in a hierarchical fashion with

Change-Id: I0f121ad5e4f80be4c790dc869955c6b299ca9f26
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Prometheus: Update chart to support federation

This updates the Prometheus chart to support federation. This
moves to defining the Prometheus configuration file via a template
in the values.yaml file instead of through raw yaml. This allows
for overriding the chart's default configuration wholesale, as
this would be required for a hierarchical federated setup. This
also strips out all of the default rules defined in the chart for
the same reason. There are example rules defined for the various
aspects of OSH's infrastructure in the prometheus/values_overrides
directory that are executed as part of the normal CI jobs. This
also adds a nonvoting federated-monitoring job that vets out the
ability to federate prometheus in a hierarchical fashion with
extremely basic overrides

Change-Id: I0f121ad5e4f80be4c790dc869955c6b299ca9f26
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Networking Baremetal is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I7f08a871ba82081f6164f84f05f50eb61cfd7541

commit_message:
This add chunk_size related parameters for proxy-server and object-server.

New parameters for proxy class are object_chunk_size and client_chunk_size,
and for storage class: network_chunk_size, disk_chunk_size and
auditor_disk_chunk_size.

Change-Id: If2bbc9cea1f6e0959fd67d2e004b607a8e40beee

messages:
[{'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-11-14 06:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-11-14 08:44:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We need a release note highlighting that anyone doing an upgrade should change their override if used.

I also think we should create a new parameter with the correct name, keep the old one but mark it deprecated by adding it to a parameter group as done here: https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/master/deployment/swift/swift-storage-container-puppet.yaml#L89-L93

commit_message:
Switch py2 DSVM jobs to only run swift under py2

Other services are fine to move on to py3. We still want to test py2,
though.

Change-Id: I488f88a54948663c682b35dc976b62db6e72eef7

commit_message:
doc: add known limitation about attaching SR-IOV ports

Nova does not currently support attaching SR-IOV ports to
existing instances, you can only create a server with an
SR-IOV port at this time. This adds an item about that
limitation to the SR-IOV admin docs.

Change-Id: I0a954de724384a81cb45446da20fa6b17d4bd63a
Related-Bug: #1708433
(cherry picked from commit 60a9248b17cad8d2e7dd49cea120348dda99dc2b)
(cherry picked from commit 7859941647077a567fc1d546652dc738273328f0)
(cherry picked from commit 354709f63ac8f83eadfce60d6fea58aa071900c2)
